dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, uh, have you seen the latest from Bernie Marcus? Like, the Home Depot co-founder?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, uh, have you seen the latest from Bernie Marcus? Like, the Home Depot co-founder?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Home Depot co-founder Bernie Marcus, who announced to the Atlanta Journal-Constitution that he plans to give away 90% of his $5.9 billion fortune to charity

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah, the, um, the big announcement, right? About his fortune?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah, the, um, the big announcement, right? About his fortune?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! He's, uh, planning to give away ninety percent of his five point nine *billion* dollar fortune to charity. Ninety percent!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! He's, uh, planning to give away ninety percent of his five point nine billion dollar fortune to charity. Ninety percent!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Home Depot co-founder Bernie Marcus, who announced to the Atlanta Journal-Constitution that he plans to give away 90% of his $5.9 billion fortune to charity

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow, that's, like, a huge chunk of change. I mean, he's already given away two billion, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow, that's, like, a huge chunk of change. I mean, he's already given away two billion, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Marcus (#337 on Forbes billionaires list with a reported $5.9 billion net worth) has said he has already donated over $2 billion to charitable organizations across the globe.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, he has! And, you know, he's actually part of The Giving Pledge, which is, uh, a group for the super wealthy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, he has! And, you know, he's actually part of The Giving Pledge, which is, uh, a group for the super wealthy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Marcus (and his wife Billi) joined the Giving Pledge in 2010, a consortium of the worlds wealthiest people who pledged to give away at least half their fortunes in their lifetimes.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right, the one Bill Gates and Warren Buffett started. [overlaps] I think Elon Musk is in there too, and Richard Branson.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, the one Bill Gates and Warren Buffett started. I think Elon Musk is in there too, and Richard Branson.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Giving Pledge was launched by Bill Gates, Melinda Gates, and Warren Buffet, and also includes Elon Musk, Richard Branson, and Michael Bloomberg.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] Yeah, exactly. And Marcus said something really interesting, like, "Everything I live for now is finding the right things to put my money into... for an emotional return."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, exactly. And Marcus said something really interesting, like, Everything I live for now is finding the right things to put my money into for an emotional return.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Everything I live for now is finding the right things to put my money into and that can give me a rate of return in emotion and doing good things for this world, said Marcus.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I love that. An emotional rate of return. And he's certainly, uh, put his money into some amazing causes already.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I love that. An emotional rate of return. And he's certainly, uh, put his money into some amazing causes already.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, for sure. I mean, the Georgia Aquarium? He gave a quarter of a *billion* dollars to build that!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, for sure. I mean, the Georgia Aquarium? He gave a quarter of a billion dollars to build that!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Marcus donated $250 million to build the Georgia Aquarium, the nations largest such facility.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And, um, Autism Speaks got twenty-five million, plus he funded the Marcus Institute for kids with developmental disabilities. That's really impactful stuff.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And, um, Autism Speaks got twenty-five million, plus he funded the Marcus Institute for kids with developmental disabilities. That's really impactful stuff.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Hes given $25 million to Autism Speaks, an autism advocacy and research operation, as well as founded and funded the Marcus Institute for children and teenagers with developmental disabilities.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It really is. But, uh, he also made a point of saying he's gonna donate to re-elect President Trump.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really is. But, uh, he also made a point of saying he's gonna donate to re-elect President Trump.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: he plans to give away 90% of his $5.9 billion fortune to charity (and added he would donate to re-elect President Trump).

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] Ah, yeah, that detail. He's been a, like, a pretty consistent supporter, hasn't he?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ah, yeah, that detail. He's been a, like, a pretty consistent supporter, hasn't he?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, big time. Seven million in 2016, then almost eight million in the 2018 midterms, all to Republicans.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, big time. Seven million in twenty sixteen, then almost eight million in the twenty eighteen midterms, all to Republicans.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Marcus was reported to be one of Trumps biggest donors in the 2016 election, having contributed $7 million to help elect him. For the 2018 midterms, Marcus donated $7.9 million to outside money groups, mostly political action committees like the Senate Leadership Fund and the John Bolton Super PAC, and entirely to Republicans.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And, um, he even, like, dinged Trump for his communication skills, but still backs him on other policies. It's, uh, quite a mix.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And, um, he even, like, dinged Trump for his communication skills, but still backs him on other policies. It's, uh, quite a mix.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Marcus dinged Trump for his communication skills, but said the president deserves praise for standing up to Iran and North Korea, working on trade with China, and increasing jobs in the U.S.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It is. But at the end of the day, you know, whether you agree with his politics or not, he's still, like, giving away billions for some pretty incredible causes.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It is. But at the end of the day, you know, whether you agree with his politics or not, he's still, like, giving away billions for some pretty incredible causes.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely. I mean, six billion in a lifetime, potentially. That's, uh, a legacy for sure.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely. I mean, six billion in a lifetime, potentially. That's, uh, a legacy for sure.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Its estimated he could give away over $6 billion in his lifetime.
